greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 1 + the number of iterations of A051953 (Euler-cototient) function needed to reach 0, starting at n.
comment: Analogous sequences of iteration-lengths for A000005 or A000010 are A036459 and A049108 resp. The length values of 3 occur if the initial value is prime resulting in {p,1,0} iterations.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Starting with n=18, the iterations of A051953 are as follows: {18,12,8,4,2,1,0}. The length of this sequence is 7, so a(18) = 7. The function is applied a(n)-1 times.
mathematica: Table[Length@ NestWhileList[# - EulerPhi@ # &, n, # > 0 &], {n, 84}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 04 2016 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 14 2000
